text: the Japanese nuclear crisis took a very
different and very scary turn on Monday
night when the vessel that contains the
nuclear material inside reactor number
two appears to have been breached for
the first time you heard Japanese
officials who've been very cautious in
recent times trying not to create panic
suddenly come out including the Prime
Minister to announce that the Japanese
people had to expect much higher and
continuous radiation levels the
immediate policy implications for Japan
are tremendous the Japanese now have to
decide whether or not to widen the
exclusion zone to evacuate more people
out away from the plant over the longer
term the Japanese are going to have to
decide whether or not people could move
back in nearer to these plants or
whether these plants will essentially be
entombed and the area may not be
inhabited for some time elsewhere in the
world other countries are going to begin
questioning what to do with their older
reactors Germany has already announced a
brief shut down to examine the safety of
its plants that hasn't happened in the
United States yet but certainly the
failure of the backup systems throughout
the Japanese plants will raise questions
about the quality of the backup systems
in similar facilities here in the United
States
